    About Me

    I am now a first-year PhD student supervised by Professor David Doermann, in Department of Computer Science and Engineering, State University of New York at Buffalo.

    Before that, I recieved B.Eng from University of Electronic Science and Technology of China (UESTC).

    Interests

    • Computer Vision, Image and Video Processing
    • Machine Learning and Deep learning

    News

    • July. 2018 The paper 'Unsupervised Saliency Detection in 3D video based on Multi-scale Segmentation and Refinement' has been ACCEPTED by IEEE. Signal Processing Letter.
    • July. 2018: I graduated from University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, with Bachelor Degree of Engineering.
    • May. 2018: I will be entering the CSE department in University at Buffalo, SUNY as a PhD student in Fall 2018.
    • Sept. 2017: I finished my 3rd year study with GPA 4.0/4.0, ranked 9/192.

    Publications
